references.paper_title: Measuring statistical dependence with Hilbert-Schmidt norms
references.reason: This paper introduced the Hilbert-Schmidt Independence Criterion (HSIC), the central concept of the current research.

references.paper_title: Hilbert space embeddings and metrics on probability measures
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for understanding the properties of HSIC and its relationship to other independence measures.

references.paper_title: Measuring and testing dependence by correlation of distances
references.reason: This paper introduced distance covariance, which is closely related to HSIC and provides an alternative approach to measuring independence.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of kernel methods, which are essential for understanding the techniques used in the estimation of HSIC.

references.paper_title: Characteristic and universal tensor product kernels
references.reason: This paper expands the theoretical understanding of HSIC to the multivariate case (M>2), which is crucial for the main results of the current work.
